COVID-19 is a disease caused by a new strain of coronavirus. 'CO' stands for corona, 'VI' for virus, and 'D' for disease. Formerly, this disease was referred to as '2019 novel coronavirus' or '2019-nCoV'.

COVID-19 spreads mainly by droplets produced as a result of coughing or sneezing of a COVID-19 infected person.This can happen in two ways: Direct close contact: one can get the infection by being in close contact with COVID-19 patients (within one Metre of the infected person), especially if they do not cover their face when coughing or sneezing. Indirect contact: the droplets survive on surfaces and clothes for many days. Therefore, touching any such infected surface or cloth and then touching one’s mouth, nose or eyes can transmit the disease.

patterns: What are the symptoms for Covid-19 ?
What are the symptoms of Covid-19 ?
responses: Most common symptoms:  -fever -dry cough -tiredness Less common symptoms: -aches and pains -sore throat -diarrhoea -conjunctivitis -headache -loss of taste or smell -a rash on skin, or discolouration of fingers or toes Serious symptoms: -difficulty breathing or shortness of breath -chest pain or pressure -loss of speech or movement.Seek immediate medical attention if you have serious symptoms. Always call before visiting your doctor or health facility.

To prevent the spread of COVID-19:Clean your hands often. Use soap and water, or an alcohol-based hand rub.Maintain a safe distance from anyone who is coughing or sneezing.Don’t touch your eyes, nose or mouth.Cover your nose and mouth with your bent elbow or a tissue when you cough or sneeze.Stay home if you feel unwell.If you have a fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical attention. Call in advance.Follow the directions of your local health authority.Avoiding unneeded visits to medical facilities allows healthcare systems to operate more effectively, therefore protecting you and others.

patterns: What is the cure for Covid-19?
Is there any cure for Covid-19?
responses: To date, there are no specific vaccines or medicines for COVID-19. Treatments are under investigation, and will be tested through clinical trials. So take plenty of self care.

patterns: Can I travel during this time?
Is it allowed to travel now?
responses: Yes, unlike the previous guidelines, the new set of rules issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs on 17 May says:-Inter-state movement of passenger vehicles and buses, with mutual consent of the state(s) and UT(s) involved. -Intra-state movement of passenger vehicles and buses, as decided by the states and UTs.

patterns: How to take care of pets during this time?
How to take care of my pet during this time?
responses: I understand how difficult it is for our pets.So..Here are some activities you can engage them in!This is a great time to train your pets.Use your pet's favorite treats to do so!Play with them.Create indoor obstacles for them to play with.

It is a stresfful time for your pets too.You can cheer them up by playing interesting games like hide n seek with them.Make diy pet toys and gift them to your pets.Feed them healthy and nutricious food and love them a lot!

patterns: Is getting groceries and vegetables safe during this time?
How to take care while buying groceries?
responses: Groceries are necessary but so are you.Make sure to wear mask before going to the store.Maintain social distancing.Once reaching home sanitize your hands as well as the products you bought.Wash your mask,dress,and grocery bag and dry them in the sun.Take care!
